lead_paragraph: The University of Colorado has agreed to pay two women $2.85 million to settle a lawsuit alleging they were sexually assaulted by football players and recruits, university officials said yesterday. The allegations sparked a recruiting scandal, prompted university reforms and led to a shake-up of the university’s leadership. The agreement came two months after an appellate court revived the lawsuit.A Colorado spokesman said the university agreed to hire an adviser to monitor compliance with federal laws governing equal treatment of women and to add a position in the university’s Office of Victim Assistance.Hank Brown, the university’s president, called the decision “painful in some ways,” but he said the university faced years of litigation over the case.
